action.action-desc: Mr. Young of Alaska (for himself and Mr. Larsen of Washington) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to improve the efficiency of summer meals.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Summer Meals Act of 2017.

section.header: Summer food service program for children

subsection.header: Better integrate summer education and summer meals program
subsection.text: Section 13(a)(1)(A)(i) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1761(a)(1)(A)(i)) is amended by striking 50 percent each place it appears and inserting 40 percent.

subsection.header: Reduce red tape for public-Private partnerships
subsection.text: Section 13(a) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1761(a)) is amended by striking paragraph (8) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: Except as otherwise determined by the Secretary, a service institution that is a public or private nonprofit school food authority may provide summer or school vacation food service in accordance with applicable provisions of law governing the school lunch program established under this Act or the school breakfast program established under the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1771 et seq.).

subparagraph.header: Year-round meal service for other service institutions
subparagraph.text: Each service institution (other than a service institution described in subparagraph (A)), in addition to being eligible for reimbursement for meals described in subsection (b)(2) served during each day of operation during the periods described in subsection (c)(1), may be reimbursed for up to 1 meal and 1 snack per child served during each day of operation during—

clause.text: school holidays during the regular school calendar.

subsection.header: Improve nutrition in underserved, hard-to-Reach areas
subsection.text: Section 13(a) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1761(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking paragraphs (9) and (10) and inserting the following:

paragraph.header: Improve nutrition in underserved, hard-to-reach areas

subparagraph.text: Subject to the availability of appropriations provided in advance in an appropriations Act specifically for the purpose of carrying out this paragraph, the Secretary may award competitive grants to service institutions selected by the Secretary to increase participation in the program at congregate feeding sites through—

clause.text: innovative approaches to limited transportation; and

subparagraph.text: To be selected to receive a grant under this paragraph, a service institution—

clause.text: may be located in any State; and

subclause.text: submit to the Secretary an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require;
meet criteria established by the Secretary; and
agree to the terms and conditions of the grant, as established by the Secretary.

subparagraph.text: In awarding grants under this paragraph, the Secretary shall give priority to service institutions that—

clause.text: serve both breakfast and lunch; or

subparagraph.text: A service institution that receives a grant under subparagraph (A)(i) may use grant funds to provide reimbursement for travel to satellite congregate feeding sites.
There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to make competitive grants under this paragraph $10,000,000 for each fiscal year.

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (11) and (12) as paragraphs (10) and (11), respectively.

subsection.text: Section 13(b)(2) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1761(b)(2)) is amended by striking only serve lunch and all that follows through migrant children may.
